cockpit.database

Class SCADASystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • cockpit.database.SCADASystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SCADASystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    SCADA Class

    This class will serve as the data container for a generic subsystem in the SCADA cockpit. Each subsystem will have a map of <ID,Sensors> and functions for adding, removing and
    Since:
    2017-03-01
    Author:
    Craig Lombardo

    • Method Detail

      • getCustomMapping

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Sensor> getCustomMapping()
        This method returns the mapping of the sensors for use in other applications, effectively the same as getMap however this method returns tag based instead of backend ID based.
        Returns:
        The Hashmap containing all key value pairs of Integer and Sensor

      • getEquations

        This method returns all of the equations found in the DB
        Returns:
        Arraylist containing all of the Equations (class Equation)

      • toggleDataSave

        public void toggleDataSave(java.lang.Boolean bool)
        Sets whether or not the system shoulk store data into the db
        Parameters:
        bool - True for store false for view only

      • updateData

        public void updateData(java.lang.Integer address,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> packets)
        This method updates the values of all of the sensors in the system. Typical can formats are like: can0 500 [8] 06 00 B3 00 00 00 3F 31 where in this case the input params would be: (500, {06, 00, B3, 00, 00, 00, 3F, 31})
        Parameters:
        address - The can address that was received
        packets - The data received over the can
